title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy
text: The Gibbs free energy (ΔG) is calculated using the formula: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS. Here, ΔH is the change in enthalpy, T is the temperature in Kelvin, and ΔS is the change in entropy.

title: Conversion Entropy and Enthalpy
text: To find ΔG° for the conversion: O₃ → $$\frac{3}{2}$$ O₂, we need:\n$$1$$. The change in enthalpy: ΔH°.\n$$2$$. The change in entropy: ΔS°.

title: Calculate ΔH° for Conversion
text: ΔH° for the conversion of ozone to O₂ can be found using:\nΔH° $$=$$ ΔH°_f(O₂) - ΔH°_f(O₃).\nGiven ΔH°_f(O₂) $$=$$ $$0$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and ΔH°_f(O₃) $$=$$ $$142.67$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$.

title: Calculate ΔS° for Conversion
text: ΔS° for the conversion of ozone to O₂ can be found using:\nΔS° $$=$$ S°(O₂) - S°(O₃).\nNote: Use the fact that when O₃ converts to $$\frac{3}{2}$$ O₂, it's $$\frac{3}{2}$$ times S°(O₂).

title: Gibbs Free Energy Calculation
text: Now use the Gibbs free energy formula with $$T=298$$ K:\nΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS.

title: Calculate ΔG° at $$298$$ K
text: Use the formula:\nΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS\n$$=$$ $$(-142.67)$$ - $$298$$ × (ΔS calculated).

title: Determine Stability
text: The form of oxygen with a more negative ΔG is more stable.
